snippet: Now that many tollbooths no longer take cash, some rental car companies have made a hearty business out of paying the tolls themselves. But there’s a catch.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column observes now that many tollbooths no longer take cash, some rental car companies have made a hearty business out of paying the tolls themselves; points out, however, the catch is a service fee to the renter; says variations on fleecing of drivers seem to be infinite.
lead_paragraph: Now that many tollbooths no longer take cash, some rental car companies have made a hearty business out of paying the tolls themselves. But there’s a catch.

headline.main: Fighting Back on Toll Fees for Rental Cars
headline.print_headline: Fighting Back on Toll Fees for Rental Cars
